|brand = D-Link |model = DIR-880L |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = A1 |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = AC1900 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = wireless router |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = KA2IR880LA1 |icid = 4216A-IR880LA1 |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4708A0;BCM4708A0, TT1342 P10, 326998-01 B1C; |cpu1_cores = 2 |cpu1_type = ARM |cpu1_type_rev = Cortex-A9 |cpu1spd = 800 |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = NAND |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Spansion;S34ML01G100TFI00; |flash1size = 128 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = DDR3 |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 256 |ram1chip = EtronTech;EM6GD16EWXC-15H; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 70:62:B8 |oui = 70:62:B8
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = USB 3.0, USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 2 |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 3 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = 2.4 GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2623L;SKY, 2623L, 34<..>;3; ,,, 5 GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5003L1;5003L1, 3426W, 1342, MY;3; |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac
|defaulip = 192.168.0.1 |defaultlogin = Admin |defaultpass = <!-- default Password, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = Alpha Networks |manuf_model = WRT-AC18 |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT<!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 02/17/2014 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B00J8NCVX4 |asin_country = US |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TE1341 P20, 324386 3 W; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL,RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad1ac = 1300 |nqam1 = <!-- 600, 750, 900, 1000 --> |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TE1341 P20, 324386 3 W; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL,RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam2 = <!-- 600, 750, 900, 1000 --> |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== It would seem '''D-Link''' is jumping on the 'big AC1900 router<!-- w/ external antennas-->' bandwagon :along with [[ASUS RT-AC68U]], [[Netgear R7000]], and [[Linksys EA6900]] :<small>(+ [[Linksys WRT1900AC]], I guess)</small>. <!-- the more the merrier.. -->
The internal '''Alpha''' model for this device may be '''WRT-AC18'''.
{{WiFiCert|WFA53472|04/01/2014}}
===Probable used PSU=== The power supply shown in the FCC external photos is an :'''Asian Power Devices''' WA-36C12R.
{{hasPowerSupply |brand = Asian Power Devices |model = WA-36C12R |input_v=100-240 |input_a= |input_c=AC |input_hz=50-60 |input_conn=NEMA 1-15P |output_v=12 |output_a=3 |output_conn=barrel |e_level= |style=large, vertical |countrymanuf = China }}
==Links of Interest== *http://forums.dlink.com/index.php?topic=72749.0 *https://forum.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=268579
===Reviews=== *[http://smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/32500-d-link-dir-880l-ac1900-wi-fi-router-reviewed On '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :70:62:B8 OUI *[http://www.shadowandy.net/2014/11/d-link-dir-880l-wireless-ac1900-dual-band-gigabit-cloud-router.htm On '''ShadowAndy'''] :CPU: [[Broadcom]] BCM4708A @800 MHz DualCore :RAM: 256 MB (DDR3), Flash: 128 MB (NAND) :Radio 2.4 GHz [[Broadcom]] BCM4360 3T3R 802.11bgn ::''Skyworks'' SE2623L 2.4 GHz Power Amplifier (x3) :Radio 5 GHz [[Broadcom]] BCM4360 3T3R 802.11an/ac ::''Skyworks'' SE5003L1 5.0 GHz Power Amplifier (x3) :Switch: [[Broadcom]] BCM4708A 1x GbE (WAN) + 4x GbE (LAN) *[https://openitforum.pl/index/recenzje/routery/dlink/d-link-dir-880l-ac1900-r235/ On '''Openitforum''']
===Chip product pages=== *[http://www.broadcom.com/products/Wireless-LAN/802.11-Wireless-LAN-Solutions/BCM4707-4708-4709 ''BCM4707/BCM4708/BCM4709'' product page @ '''Broadcom'''] *[http://www.etron.com/en/search/search.php?source=partno&search_01=EM6GD16EWXC ''EM6GD16EWXC'' product search @ '''EtronTech''']
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Taken from the D-Link forums: (will try it later) # Plug the Ethernet cable that connects your computer, that was plugged into one of the LAN ports, # Setup your PC with static IP - ex: 192.168.0.2 (different from 192.168.0.1) # Make sure the PC has the new firmware # Unplug the power # Hold the reset button for 3~5 seconds and re plug the power WITHOUT RELEASING THE RESET BUTTON. # Open a web browser to 192.168.0.1 and then you should see EMERGENCY FLASHING page then click browse/upload locate the file and click UPLOAD FIRMWARE NOW # You should see a SUCCSESS page, If you donâ€™t then re do steps 2-6
*See discussion page
[[Category:English Documentation]]
